intro: Artabotrys taynguyenensis, commonly known as the Tay Nguyen artabotrys, is a flowering plant native to the Central Highlands of Vietnam. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, with a smooth texture. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
